bibl.title: Letter from John W. Hart to Philip Showalter Hench, June 2, 1942

div1.p: Hart describes a recent trip to the Cuban Army Medical Department at Columbia Barracks, and sends Hench a photograph from the trip.

div1.head: Letter from John W. Hart to Philip Showalter Hench, June 2, 1942
div1.opener:
WINTHROP PRODUCTS, INC.
170 VARICK STREET
NEW YORK, N.Y.
June 2, 1942
P. O. Box 90
CANAL ST. STATION
CABLE ADDRESS
“W I N C O X”
Dr. Philip Hench,
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
I have just returned from a trip to Central and South America and on
the way down, stopped off in Cuba and visited the Medical Department
of the Cuban Army at Colombia Barracks. Knowing my interest in Walter
Reed, Finley, et al, they very kindly gave me a Government car and
the services of three of the medical officers to visit the site of
the Walter Reed Experimental Building.

Having in mind your excellent article in the Reports to the Mayo Clinic
and the photograph of yourself in front of the Medical Building, I
take pleasure in sending you a photograph I took at the same site.
With kind personal regards and hoping to see you at the A.M.A. meeting,
div1.closer: Cordially yours, John W. Hart jwh-jn
